Reviews.Title: “Economy overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: Treviglas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and basic. Chosen for closeness to Barajas airport as only wanted a bed for a few hours sleep between flights and did not require great amenities. Within a 5 min taxi ride of the airport. Hotel is small, entrance on a main street. Room was small but very clean, toilet and shower facilities excellent for such a small (and elderly) hotel. I expect this was an old travellers' hotel taken over by Best Western and redecorated (no glitz!). A small breakfast/bar area off the main foyer. No coffee making facilities in the room I had (small twin bedded) but free coffee and tea available all night in the breakfast bar area. Other soft drinks/confectionery only available from a vending machine in the same area. Very economical, staff (I only met the two guys looking after the place at night) very friendly and helpful. For one night between flights if you just want to get your head down in comfort for a few hours and have good shower toilet facilities then this place is ideal. Would probably not recommend for familes with kids but good for the individual traveller with modest requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well located”
Reviews.Author: AndAlmeida
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is located close to the metro station, close to the airport. Rooms are modern, specially the bath room. Staff is friendly and helpful. Free cofee and internet! If i ever need again a hotel close the airport, I'll pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlenaC
Reviews.Content: An acceptable place to stay if you have a layover in Madrid. It was not bad, but nothing really impressed me either. Rooms are tiny, true. An ok breakfast. Staff is nice, but not very competent. I made a reservation in advance over the phone. I noticed my credit card was not charged, so I decided to call them to make absolutely sure I do have a reservation. The guy on the other end told me I needed to call next day and talk to the manager. To talk to the manager to make sure you have a reservation? I called again two days later and I had better luck then.When I was checking in, the guy at the reception got destructed 10 times before he finally finished checking me in. I woke up in the middle of the night because my skin began to itch ina couple of spots. It felt like it was because the sheets were not rinced off thoroughly from detergent. Very convenient location close from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “One night before flying out”
Reviews.Author: vido93
Reviews.Content: Very tiny rooms, has good breakfast, very close to airport, friendly staff, and has transportation to airport. Very challenging parking in the basement. It has free wifi. I would have rated it a 3 stars, until I saw the bug bites on my daughter. No bites the day before. She slept in the rollaway bed.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room near the airport”
Reviews.Author: iophir
Reviews.Content: Had few hours of layover so decided to take BW for some sleep. Shuttle service was very efficient, the ride is about 10 minutes. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very small with a single bed and tiny bathroom. It is good inexpensive options if you want to rest for few hours

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JohnandCarolineUK
Reviews.Content: Call to get the shuttle to pick you up, very efficient. Good clean rooms and nice simple breakfast. Perfect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkkk64
Reviews.Content: Picked up by hotel shuttle at airport and taken directly to hotel. We had a clean comfortable room with ensuite facilities. The breakfast had a good selection. Close to Metro to travel to centre!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacquiandJohn
Reviews.Content: My flight was delayed and it was nearly 1 am when I arrived by taxi ( about 20 euros), as the free shuttle bus had stopped running for the night. I was warmly welcomed and given the key to a quiet, spotlessly clean room with good air con and a comfortable bed. What more could I ask? The next morning I had a very good buffet breakfast, which included hot cooked items as well as cold meats, cheeses, cereals, baked goods, fresh fruit, juices and good coffee. I used the shuttle bus to return to the airport to meet my friend, who was travelling from a different UK airport. The driver was most helpful, ensuring that he dropped me not only at the correct terminal, but at arrivals rather than check in. By the way, I noticed that there were bars and cafes near he hotel, so if you wanted you could get some evening refreshment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beds and good A/C”
Reviews.Author: isaHolanda
Reviews.Content: We got the shuttle at the airport. You MUST HAVE to call the hotel, otherwise they are not passing by the airport. We waited for about 40 minutes after calling the hotel at the stop for shuttles, where there was not shadow and the temperature was around 33C (90F). I was very upset but the friendly staff, the comfortable beds and the working A/C made me forget about the shuttle thing when we arrived at the hotel. Rooms are very small, the bed covers are a little bit outdated, but when you remove them you have a wonderful bed with clean and new sheets. My partner was sick and they allowed us to do a late check-out without extra charges. Breakfast was good. Metro station is around 5 minutes walking and to the city center of Madrid, for instance to Station Callao, you should change once of line and it takes around 40 minutes. There are not too much stores in the area but plenty choice of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A sleep and breakfast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sinders172
Reviews.Content: Great, small, reasonably priced, simple hotel, ideal for sleeping outside the city. Very near the airport with complimentary bus service. Very near tube to get into Madrid. Staff were great, super kind and friendly. Rooms very simple, small,very clean and with working wifi. Breakfast, very good and complete, buffet style. A great hotel to spend a night if you have an early flight or a good place to stay if you prefer to sleep out of the city when visiting Madrid. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sandraK60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 6th May then again 14th May (before and after our holiday), could not fault it for location, cleanliness and price. 77 euros for a room for 2 with breakfast (including some cooked food), free shuttle bus to and from the airport which is only minutes away. All of the staff we encountered spoke English and we had free internet access with 2 netbooks available all day. Very close to the metro (Barajas station) and several eating/drinking places nearby. Would definitely stay again if we are travelling from Madrid airport. It's not luxury but for the price, I wouldn't expect that. If you arrive in Madrid by train, it's very easy to get to this hotel by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay or a connecting flight”
Reviews.Author: DoctorSotos
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in a triple room (2 singles and a sofa) with two friends. We have booked the hotels due to the proximity to the airport, where we had some bussines on May 1st. The room was good enough for the 3 of us, clean and quiet. We had a plumbing problem on our first night (flooded bathroom) so we were given 3 single rooms, free of charge !!! The breakfast was OK, good quality and quantity. There were 2 netbooks in the lobby for internet access, but there was a network connection problem during our stay, so internet wasn't allways available. In means of location and transportation, the hotel is located around 500 meters from the Metro Station "Barajas" so there isn't any problem if you are traveling with kids or luggage. The hotel also provides free shuttle to/from the airport 24/7. There is a grocery store just opposite the hotel, a Burger King on the corner and a chinese restaurant just accros the street as well as a few more "expencive" reataurants in the area. Overall experience was good. The hotel is good for a short stay or a connecting flight but not for more than this.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: FotisAthens
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights on 30th April & 1st May. It's an average hotel close to the airport. Not bad for spending the night before catching your morning flight, but don't expect a luxury hotel. I didn't expect something more for 60 euro/per night for a double bed (without breakfast) (-): Free Wifi internet was not working. (+): Free shuttle bus from/to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon1403
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the end of a Madrid trip to catch a 8am flight. Rooms are clean, nicely done up and the hotel is about a 35 minute train ride to the Gran Via station in Madrid. Really good value for money as they also have a shuttle bus from 6am onwards to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bon, correct”
Reviews.Author: Treuiller
Reviews.Content: Le service Wi-Fi est gratuit (mais un peu lent) et on peut se reposer tranquillement. Bien situé si on doit prendre un vol depuis l'aéroport de Barajas tôt le lendemain. Conveniently placed, close to Barajas airport, if one needs to take an early flight on the next day. Free Wi-Fi service, but slow. Calm rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Jim and Pat B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a find for travelers who are in transit via Madrid. Why pay high prices to stay in the city when you only have an evening? This hotel is 250 meters from a metro to the old city of Madrid, cost was 59 Euros per night for two in double bed. They offer free pick up van from airport (we called from Terminal 1) and they were there in 10 minutes; returned us to airport next morning for no cost as well. We took train from Sevilla to Atocha Train station in Madrid, took the Expres Aeropuerto Bus outside of Train station to airport Terminal 1 and called the hotel for pick up. Easy, easy, easy! Cafeteria in hotel is good for fixed price, unlimited buffet breakfast. Wifi free and accessible in room. Great room and shower and amenites. This is a no brainer hotel for transit purposes and we highly recommend. Nice, helpful staff. Clean, comfortable and value exceptional. Nearby restaurants not so good. If you have the time, go into Madrid on Metro. If not, accept it and go Chinese across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa De Barajas management unwilling to help!”
Reviews.Author: ejaiello
Reviews.Content: I purchased a non-refundable/advance booking for this hotel due to a airline layover in Madrid 11 months in advance (planned for Sept 2012). The airline cancelled the flight that would put me overnight in Madrid. I asked the hotel if they could refund me as this is out of my control in January, still 9 months in advance. They have absolutely refused to refund me. BW International & my CC company have both asked for a refund and still they refuse. What would possible motive this property to keep my money under such circumstances? BW International even told me exceptions could be made in this case but they were not able to get the Hotel Villa De Barajas to budge. I pass this along to other travelers in sheer principle alone. I would think twice before giving them the satisfaction of the your business.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover stay”
Reviews.Author: BluelineAdventures
Reviews.Content: I had a 12-hour stopover in Madrid on a Prague-Denver series of flights, so this hotel was a good place to sleep for the night. Yes, the rooms are small but this is, above all else, an airport hotel and that is what you get with airport hotels. I wouldn't want to stay in the room more than one night, but for an overnight stopover it worked well. The room itself was comfortable (but small, as mentioned above), and the furniture and fittings had been updated recently, with a comfortable bed. The bathroom I had was decent sized, and I saw none of the issues with the plumbing or cleanliness that other reviewers mentioned. It looks like the hotel has taken the complaints about noise to heart as I had a street-facing room, and had no issues with street noise due to the double windows. The breakfast buffet was typical of a European hotel (breads, cheese, yogurt, eggs, sausage, etc...), and I found the selection and the food to be good. The hotel itself was clean, and very convenient to the airport. I did not bother with the shuttle from the airport to the hotel, but the cab ride was only 14 Euros - it was well worth the minimal cost to me to get to the hotel without waiting. I did take the shuttle from the hotel back to the airport, and it was very quick and convenient. As others have mentioned, food and restaurants in the area are minimal at best, but if you have more than a few hours here a trip into Madrid is quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, comfortable, nice neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: JayandPeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect place for our last night in Spain before flying home the next day. Our room was average sized compared with the places we stayed during our 3 week visit. We found easy street parking and a choice of restaurants in this residential neighborhood. The accomodations were comfortable and clean, making this a perfect place to repack, regroup, and sleep at the end of a very fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small every thing , Small Room, Small Breakfast....”
Reviews.Author: DM0619
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel way not worth staying there. The Hotel rooms are very small when you travel as often as I do and found that the room was very small. The Shower was to small in size as well. It might be good for small people ( midgets) but not a 6ft 196 pound guy like my self. The people i have no complaints about they are really nice and want to help and accommodate you every way they can. The Continental breakfast was nothing editable for a United States citizen like my self. They don’t have a computer room , they have 1 computer for guest to use, and its this small little mini computer ( not even a full size) LOL goes with the half size shower also (LOL) . I had a problem with the water going down in the shower and they quickly came to fix the problem but if you would ask me would i stay there again the answer would have to be a NO. Sorry to disappoint you all that was hoping i would say yes

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value and an absolutely terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Iceler
Reviews.Content: Tremendous value and an absolutely terrific staff. Located one stop from either of the Madrid Airport metro stops and then only two blocks from the Barajas train station this is great buy. I got a room for about 71.00 U.S dollars, including tax during January. There are plenty of restaurants nearby (try Al Traste Fun & Food) and a lot of friendly bars filled with folks that are staying at one of the many nearby hostels. I will start with the two negatives so that I can finish with positives: The shower was difficult to enter because a shower assembly was constructed above the bathtub. Not all rooms are this was so if you have any problems raising above a three foot wall or are elderly make sure you get a room with an easily accessible shower. The internet was a little shaky so I went four blocks away to Al Traste Fun & Food; however, I have to be fair and say that I appeared to be the only person complaining about intermittent internet. Now on to the positive. They have an airport shuttle and pick you up promptly or you can take the pink metro line one stop to Barajas station. The beds are firm and nice, the toiletries are decent enough but if you prefer using a bar of soap bring your own because they provide the ones that are about one inch by two inches. If you drop this "bar" once forgetabout it! The hardwood floors were new and beautiful, there is ample closet space and hangers, a closet safe, a television (dominated by German channels) and nice thick towels. The colors were modern and vibrant and the desk, although small, provided enough space to work. The elevator is the smallest (two people and two suitcases maximum) I have ever seen but it did the job. The little bar area was nice and they lay out a really nice continental breakfast with numerous types of pastries and coffee. They also have a small internet center and provide two laps to use until 1: am. The hotel is a thirty minute metro ride to Central Madrid which I liked because it was great to get away and retire for the night in a less populated area. Finally, the people that work behind the desk are nice genuine folks.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, orderly and clean”
Reviews.Author: carlosochoa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel as I had a long stopover in Madrid. It is located in Barajas, just a 10 minute walk to the metro station, which puts you in reach of central Madrid. The hotel has its own shuttle to and from the airport. When arriving, you must call them (beware, there is no public telephone in the shuttle waiting area of T4). When going back to the airport, there is a regular schedule. Reception was speedy. Rooms are good for one person, with complimentary candies. Bathroom was almost the same size as the sleeping area. But everything was clean and recently furnished. Buffet breakfast is included and has good variety. There is free wifi available 24 hours in the rooms, and also a public computer in the lobby which shuts down at 24:00 (!!). There is also cable TV with many channels, but there is a "trick" to get to them that I only discovered a few hours later. In summary, the hotel is convenient if your travel plans give you a very short time to visit Madrid but you still need to be on time for those early flights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for transfer stays”
Reviews.Author: robbowan
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Central America we stayed twice at the BW Villa de Barajas waiting for transfer flights the day after. As we travelled with a 10 month old baby it was really convenient to just let the hotel know you were passing the gates at the airport and have thetransfer bus arrive within minutes. Check-in and check-out was very smooth as has also been the case with all our communication (mail or phone) with the hotel. The room we had (same on both occasions) was of good size and really felt fresh and clean. As a coffee freak not having a kettle was a smalllet down but that you could order from the hotel bar. Breakfast didn't have a large spread when it came to variety, but the alternatives wereof good quality.

Reviews.Title: “a convenient stay near Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NativeCalif
Reviews.Content: The Best Western in the Madrid suburb of Barajas has been our stop 4 times coming and going from Spain. It is very convenient as the staff do free pickup to and from the airport, but it is also very easy to get to and from it by the metro that goes to the airport. It is a couple of blocks walk from the subway station, and we've used it for going into Madrid for the day as well. The price is reasonable, and while the rooms are typically small for the average 'economy' hotel in Europe, they are adequate and the facilities in them quite ok. The personnel are very helpful and friendly and the breakfast (included in the price we've gotten through Hotels.com) has been above par. We found a nearby neighborhood restaurant on a small square (wish I'd noticed the name of it!) that had superlative food at a good price. I believe the square had a church, as is typical for smaller towns and cities in general, but that is all I can remember to help folks with location, unfortunately. There isn't a lot around the hotel other than a few other restaurants here and there (didn't try the largest one just across the street and down about a block), but it is a very convenient stopover. I can't say I'd experienced any worries about the neighborhood and there wasn't a lot of noise when we've stayed there, which is about 5 nights overall. If you are looking for luxury, ambience or being in central Madrid, this isn't for you. But clean, convenient to the airport and reasonably priced (we'd stayed March, 2011 and July, 2009) it's fine. Dreary, small and without character? This is Europe, folks, don't expect the same for your money as American styles. Pay a lot more and stay somewhere else if you want that. One thing I'd learned while staying in Spain in 2011 is that many cities have 'aparthotels' which are 'apartment hotels' in which you can get very reasonably priced 'apartment' accommodations for the price of a room elsewhere. Don't expect that in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: cdntourist1234
Reviews.Content: If you only need a quick sleep stay here, otherwise don't bother. Rooms are tiny but clean. Metro is nearby to get downtown. Breakfast is not worth the price. Shuttle to the airport is convenient. Hotel is noisy so bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel With Easy Access to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: TropicsTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport. It had free shuttle pick-up and drop-off. You need to call the hotel when you arrive at the airport and have your luggages but the wait was less than 15 minutes. The hotel staff were very friendly and did their best to accomodate us when we asked what we can see and do in the short 18 hours we had in Madrid before getting in our rental car to drive to the south of Spain. The metro was a short 5 minute walk from our hotel doorstep. The surrounding neighbourhood was very quiet and clean. We could not tell that the airport was only a short 10 minute drive away. We found the metro very convenient and easy to use. The trip from the hotel to Plaza Del Sol was about 30 - 40 minutes...but no parking hassle, no one way streets to navigate, no worry about hiding our car antenna, etc, etc. The next day since we had planned to go back into the city for the morning we asked the hotel to stow our luggage behind the desk. We hopped on the subway, went sightseeing for another 3 hours and came back to gather our luggage, get the free shuttle back to the airport and get our rental car. The room was small but clean and looked very modern. There was free internet on two laptops in the lobby which we used and there was a free breakfast which was more than just bread and juice. All in all we would definitely stay at this hotel again if travelling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: My impression and evaluation of this hotel is like most others in that it is convenient to the airport and good for an overnight wait for your next flight. The shuttle arrived at the time estimated ( but took forever, it seemed getting to the hotel due to stops at other terminals) and the shuttle back was timely as well. Shuttles leave the hotel on a regular schedule. We stayed here primarily because I had BW points that allowed me a free stay (20,000 points for a night). The desk clerk spoke decent English but was perturbed that I did not have my BW member card or number. ( I confess, I should have had it) but he found all my relevant information on the BW website with minimal effort. These rooms are tiny, hardly bigger than the bed and have a very small but adequate bathroom. The shower stall was a bit cramped and the provisions, soap,etc. were a bit skimpy. However, the place was quiet, the bed comfortable and it had a TV. A breakfast buffet was included in the price and was surprisingly good and well supplied.The young lady that was working in the breakfast room was very nice and accomodating. My primary objection was that this is a sparsely furnished, very basic hotel and I am not sure it would be worth the price if I had been paying for it. Also the hallways had some kind of foul odor that probably was due to poor ventillation. The hotel supplied two laptops, the very small 6-8 inch variety in the lobby that were somewhat of a joke. I am very neutral about this place, but my experience there could not be described as a negative one either.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay or overnight connect”
Reviews.Author: kja000
Reviews.Content: Best Western Hotel Villa De Barajas suited us very well on our overnight connect. The hotel's own shuttle service was just a phonecall away and arrived to the airport to pick us up swiftly. The time of our return ride was set at check-in, very convenient. Our room was on the top most floor, even the elevator didn't go all the way there and we had to walk stairs from 5th to 6th floor, but that wasn't a problem to us since we only had carry-on bags with us. The room was small-ish but in good shape and very clean. There were complimentary soaps, toothpaste etc available for people who didn't have their own toiletries with them. The hotel had WiFi and it worked well all the way up there and I had no problem getting connection with my phone and galaxy tab. The hotel staff was nice, easy-going and spoke english well enough so we had not problems getting things sorted out. The price we paid for our room (65 euros for 1 night double room) was a bit on the higher side, but keep in mind it includes free airport shuttle and also breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jesllon
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 12 hours awaiting a flight. The room was nice, reasonably priced, and the staff was great! We had free breakfast, but had to leave before. They made a special "picnic" meal for us to take.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: VSPE
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Villa de Barajas is a small hotel located one metro stop from either T-1,2 or T-4 terminals. There is 150 meter walk from metro to the city block (according to Burger King commercial at exit from metro - follow that direction) and than maybe another 50 meters to the hotel door. Good things - hotel is clean. Bed is clean and firm. Internet - works good enough to watch live video, because TV for some reason was voiceless??? Bad things - room is about 10X10 (bathroom is separate) feet and occupied by nice size bed, so moving inside room is limited even for average sized person. AC kind worked. Bathtub is tiny by USA standards (but clean). Safe is not free. Room walls need some update, but they are not falling apart and clean. The breakfast was average and selection with exception for cold cuts was very uninspiring. Transportation to and from terminals is free by shuttle, but you need to call from terminal T4. Its easier to take one stop metro. The front desk personnel speaks good English and helpfull. In one word is a good hotel for one night sleep if your plane leaves very early and if you are changing planes and need overnight sleep. Trying to make this hotel as part of your discovery of Madrid probably should be avoided. Also, I dont think that this hotel is handicapped friendly mainly on a ground floor. Also it could be done by opening normally closed doors.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ronc41
Reviews.Content: Our room at the hotel was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We used the free shuttle to and from the airport--a major convenience given the cost of taxis. We found the free breakfast to be absolutely amazing. There is a nearby Metro station that gets you to the heart of Madrid in about 20 minutes or so. There are also several restaurants and cafes near the hotel. A great place to stay in Madrid if you want to or need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: MSYCajun
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 12 Oct 2011. Had room 404, small balcony overlooking a (the?) main street in Barajas. Clean room, comfortable bed, the polite desk clerk spoke excellent English and made helpful dinner suggestions. Small LCD TV, but it worked, good water pressure in the shower. Robust wifi in the room and several computers for public use on ground floor. Complications: Altho they may pickup from different terminals, they prefer to go to the hotel shuttle pickup point in T4. There's a free shuttle bus at the airport that goes from T4 to the other terminals. You have to call for a pickup. The hard part was calling. It took 30 min. of trying off and on to get thru on the pay phones (select English, don't try to use a US credit card, deposit 0.5 Euro and just dial the # shown on the board outside, 99 whatever, don't try for a + sign). If you have local sim card then you won't have to worry about this, which is not the fault of the hotel. My Verizon LG phone didn't work so I had to use the pay phones. I had trouble using the phone in the room to call the desk, but that's minor. (this was not a good trip for phones...) On calling from T4 for pickup, they said 10 minutes and were there on time. For drop-off, they will take you to your desired terminal, leaving every 1/2 hr in the morning. If you miss the shuttle in the morning, turn left out of the hotel, walk 300 m to the metro - it was 2.5 euro for one stop (a surcharge for airport access). Many US carriers use T1 or T2, rather than T4. Barajas is between the airport metro stops. If going to the hotel from Madrid on the metro, don't go to the airport for a pickup, just get off at the Barajas station, go out and walk right 300 m. In retrospect, wish I'd taken the metro to the hotel, was less frustrating than the pay phones. The 2.5 euro fare for a short, one stop, trip on the metro seemed high but those who have taken taxi to/from MAD from this hotel have reported really high fares to Tripadvisor. Mini-mart almost directly across the street from the hotel and a pleasant restaurant across the street and to the right - in the same block as the mini-mart.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Candice_and_I
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ this hotel for one night on 5th June 2011. I went to see a charity football match featuring both Real Madrid & Bayern Munich classico's including both Zidane & Figo. The hotel has very modern interior & easy on the eye. Fantastic customer service & checked in within minutes. Spacious room with nice bathroom, comfy bed, 32' lcd tv & free Wifi which I thought was a fantastic addition and made my stay even better. The train station is about 3 minutes down the road and 4 train stops from The Real Madrid football ground! Overall I enjoyed my stay here and will definetly be back

Reviews.Title: “Small and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Leddy215
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Best Western one night as I was to catch a flight to the States the next day and they offered shuttle service to the airport. I arrived late and was checked in by a nice man. He gave me my room key, told me I would need to take the elevator up and then climb one more flight of stairs and there would be my room. The room was clean, small and looked at over roof tops. I felt as though these two rooms on the top floors were converted maid's quarters. In the morning there was a little spread of bagels and toast but really no one around to answer questions or to restock any of the food. For one night it was fine but I don't think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY small room but it served its purpose.”
Reviews.Author: AJinTO
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and our two young boys stayed at this hotel for one night. It is a small but quaint hotel in the town of Barajas a few minutes from the airport. We booked their room with two twins and a pull out bed. There room is small and is not the kind of hotel room you would want to hang out in because of its size. It is clean and has a small desk, flat screen tv, stand-up shower and storage for your suitcases. If all you want is a good shower and to sleep then this hotel is adequate. They offer free access to the internet on two mini laptops in the lounge. Our room included the buffet breakfast, which had a selection of mainly pork meat products, cheese, scrambled eggs, some fruit, cereal, pastries, juice, coffee and tea. The front desk was helpful and gave directions to center of Madrid. Subway is a two minute walk and the trip to the city center was not more than 30mins by subway. The area is quite with a decent selection of stores, restaurants and fast food joints like Burger King within walking distance. There is a frozen food store down the road and a convenience store across the street. This hotel offers a free subway shuttle which you have to call for, mind you when we called they were quick and very helpful with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet for an overnight at Barajas”
Reviews.Author: mexdoc
Reviews.Content: I booked this Best Western online when I suddenly discovered my connecting flight had been changed by the airline and no longer connected the same day. The main reason for the choice was the airport pickup and drop-off that is included. There is a time schedule and it does not run 24 hours, but indeed does run almost all day long. Be sure to check. Following the hotel´s instructions, I met the transport which arrived at the curb indicated soon after I called in. My room was small, immaculate, and had everything I needed. I had broken my foot in Morocco a few days before and right then i truly appreciated all the ease and service I was paying for as I crossed three continents to get home hobbling. If you do not want to book their abundant breakfast in those pricey Euros, there are several cafes right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: Larry 69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 7 minutes from a Metro stop, and has a complementary airport shuttle service. The rooms are small and clean; the shower controls are too modern for comfort. The complementary breakfasts are adequate. The receptionists are pleasant and extremely helpful. The rates are commensurate with the amenities. Larry69

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel and rooms”
Reviews.Author: PatrikPatrik
Reviews.Content: I spend here just two nights, but it wasn't so comfortable stay. The hotel is 3*** and quite small also with small rooms. Breakfast were average.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, free shuttle to airport”
Reviews.Author: ChipoChipolini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok when you need to reach the airport early in the morning (although the shuttle´s driver didn´t shower). Breakfast is ok but in order to be on time in the airport it should begin at 6 or 6:30am at least. Wifi didn´t work and room were very tiny but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Red0ni0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on May 25.-for next day flight Normally would have stayed downtown but demonstrators in Puerto del Sol caused me to shorten trip and fly out next day. Also had worry that volcano ash would mess up airline system inn Europe. Paid a liitle more to get queen size bed and breakfast and still had very good price. Room was typical European size-not ;arge like US. BTW-if your a senior citizen, you get better rates; used Best Western main site. Nice location is on a city street with many Spanish restaurants/bars to eat dinner-ate directly across hotel which had English menu available and nice tapas selection. My room was fine, no noise as others ascribe Breakfast was delightful. Fruits, cereals, hot foods, juices;coffees;pastries,cold meatscheeses-Absolutely no complaints. Biggest problem I had was at the Barajas airport. 1. Finding somewhere to call hotel to get free shuttle van.Two Spanish persons helped me on this. Was in T1 and could not find where you call hotel like in US airports. 2. Next problem was to find where to stand to get shuttle van. No, it's not airport curbside but there is an island where all the hotel shuttle buses stop. Once you know, no problem. Pick up van took 15 minutes-ok time for me and return from hotel to T1 took 15 minutes. Both were fine. I had planned to stay ay the HIlton but except for the room size, you can't get better value.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast, not far from metro stop”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_KateMKE
Reviews.Content: With this hotel, it is what it is: an airport hotel. But for an airport hotel, I thought it was quite nice. Cute waiting area in the lobby, two computers, a bar area with a TV, and a big dining room. We opted to get breakfast the next morning and that was a good choice. Lots of options for food--both of us got seconds. Coffee, baked goods, fresh fruit, baguettes, eggs, ham, etc. The rooms were nice enough. The hotel staff was friendly, though I thought it was strange that in order to print off anything, you had to email it to a certain email address and then ask the staff to print it for you. We're not trusted with a printer? Other hotels trusted their patrons with printers. This was a minor annoyance when we were trying to reserve and print off our boarding passes for our flights the next day and a map. Oh and we were only given one key when there were two of us. This became a problem at night since you need a key to activate the lights in the room. One wanted to go to bed but stay up awhile first, and the other wanted to go to a friend's room for awhile. If I took the key, she'd be in the dark. If I left the key, I'd have to wake her up to get back into the room. Was kind of strange to only have one key card. The free airport shuttle was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the BW Villa de Barajas was for one night in room 405 before a morning flight home. I liked the neighborhood location of this hotel as it was nice to be able to have the availabilty of several restaurants and shops while still at an airport hotel. The van arrived shortly after being called from the airport and the driver offered friendly advice on the area. Check-in was friendly and effecient and information was offered about breakfast the following morning and free wifi sign-on. There is a nice free coffee machine located off of the main lobby with vending machines and ice. The decor of the lobby and rooms are modern and the room, while small, is set up effeciently with good lighting, many television channels, and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was spotless, although I didn't like the lack of bar soap, my room only had liquid soap dispensers in the shower and at the sink. Unfortunately the dispenser in the shower ran out of soap after one and a half showers. In the evening and early morning hours I could hear very clear conversations coming from adjoining rooms. Ear plugs solved this problem, but, was annoying. Nice shutters blocked out all light from the windows. Transportation back to the airport was prompt and effecient. As stated in previous reviews, breakfast was minimally adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: starliner
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and tidy. Staff are polite, friendly and nothing too much trouble. Hotel rate was good at 60 euros for a twin bedded room, with an excellent breakfast included. A really good choice as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Shrillyd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its proximity to the airport and that it had private parking available. It was very difficult to find even with a sat nav and on arrival I was told that as I had a "big car" it would not fit in the underground carpark. After 8 hours of driving, I was furious, as this should have been pointed out to me when I booked and requested parking. The receptionist was unhelpful, shrugged his shoulders and walked away, very rude. The courtesy bus driver came to our aid and took us down to the car park and we decided that we probably could get the car in. We did eventually succeed, when the driver moved one of the hotel courtesy bueses for us. Our room was clean, but very small and very noisy. You have no option but to listen to any TV programmes that your neighbours might be watching. The other reason for booking the hotel was free wi fi. You are told to ring reception for the code, but when you do that then the unhelpful receptionist tells you it is in the black folder, which actually it wasnt. I went down to reception where he silently wrote it on a piece of paper with no word of apology. On our departure he decided it would be a laugh not to open the garage door so we would have to come back upstairs again. Clearly this hotel doesnt care who it employs or bother to give any training in customer service. The bar area consists of a machine supplying free tea and coffee and a vending machine for anything else you might want. There are a number of reasonably priced hotels near the airport, choose one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to the airport”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for its proximity to Madrid airport and the rate was excellent. There was a free shuttle bus pick up and drop off at the airport and the check in was efficient and swift. The staff was very helpful in recommending places to eat and the cafe and restaurant were across the road from the hotel. The room was clean albeit a bit cosy but for one night stay, it was fine. The hotel is on a main road but the hum faded into the background on going to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value near airport”
Reviews.Author: hkmny
Reviews.Content: This is a good business quality hotel located near the Madrid airport. One of the best things about the hotel is the airport shuttle--many hotels near the airport don't have shuttles. The hotel's rooms are fairly small, typical of comparable hotels in Madrid. Rooms are modern, with good wifi connection. There are also 2 computers in the lobby with internet access. There isn't a restaurant inside the hotel, but there is a Spanish restaurant, Chinese take-away, and grocery store right across the street, and a Burger King down the street. I think there's a metro stop near the hotel, but not 100% sure. I probably wouldn't stay here if planning to spend time in Madrid, but it's definitely a good place to stay for a night if you have a flight to catch out of MAD the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: flowerfun
Reviews.Content: Good choice for an airport location. Free shuttle means the rental car can be returned the evening before to minimize hassles the day of departure. Hotel staff was pleasant, informative and English speaking. Room was comfortable and very clean. Bathroom was clean. There was a sliding door to the bathroom which was awkward to use. Breakfast is standard Best Western style, meats, eggs, breads, fruit, coffee etc. Free wireless only worked in the lobby. Several choices to eat within walking distance to hotel. I would stay here again for airport location only not so convenient if you were spending lots of time in old town Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for early morning flights, very modern and clean.”
Reviews.Author: PedasoDeChica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as our connecting flight was early the next morning. The free hotel transfer picked us up within 15 minutes of calling, staff very friendly and helpful, rooms small but modern and very comfortable. Bathroom brilliant. Free Wi-Fi. Highly recommend if you want to stay close to the airport, and its not far from Madrid center with the tube.

Reviews.Title: “It fulfills its purpose.”
Reviews.Author: itsmej
Reviews.Content: It is a very decent hotel with good service that one can utilize on the way to the airport. The area is not nice because of its proximity to the airport. I thought the rooms were very decent, but small. But I didn't pay much so I got what I paid for. They have a free shuttle to that is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for overnight stay before flying in or out of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lovestraveling53
Reviews.Content: We were flying from Alicante Airport to Madrid and needed an overnight hotel, close to the airport for a international flight the next morning. What appealed to me was the free shuttle service to and from the hotel. Upon arrival at the Madrid airport, I called the hotel after collecting our bags, and they instructed us where to go stand outside. It took about 15 minutes for the shuttle van to arrive and then about 5 minutes to reach the hotel. We had prebooked and prepaid via the internet, our hotel room, prior to leaving the USA. Check in was fast and we took the elevator to our room and left the bags and inquired at the hotel lobby how to find & ride the metro. He gave us a Metro map & circled the 2 stops we would need to change at, to get to our final destination. It was about 2 blocks down the street to the Barajas Metro Stop. We showed the map to the man at the ticket booth and he sold us our round trip tickets to the city center. It was about a 35 minute metro ride to the station we got off at in the city center (near the Prado). The room was small, but very clean and the bathroom very modern with a powerful, hot shower. There was a nice big closet that held 2 suitcases. We were on the street side and had sliding doors that led onto a tiny, glass enclosed balcony with 2 chairs. There were blinds on the windows, which you could raise & open the windows. The next morning, we were in the breakfast room when it opened at 7am. I was expecting just coffee & juice and maybe a roll, but it was a surprise to see all that was offered. You would not leave there hungry. We were told that we needed to be in the lobby 15-20 minutes before the shuttle left and had no problems returning to the Madrid airport the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NYKnowledge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our trip to Spain and wish that we had stayed there for the first three days we spent in Madrid at the beginning. Pickup from the airport was very prompt and courteous as was the return to the airport. Breakfast was very good, and there was free acces to computers and to coffee and tea all day. The Metro was very near and we used it for additional sightseeing. Best of all. it was very quiet and peaceful and we could sleep well. which was in sharp contrast to our earlier stay in Best Western Los Condes. This hotel is in a real neighborhood and thus not like a typical airport hotel. It's a great value. w

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for short visit”
Reviews.Author: phox50
Reviews.Content: We flew into Madrid late, had the following day to tour, and departed the morning of the third day. We decided to stay near the airport, use the airport shuttle, and travel by metro into town on our touring day. This is not an airport hotel--it is on a neighborhood street with excellent restaurants. The shuttle, service, and breakfast were wonderful. The room was tiny but that is not surprising for what we paid. Comfortable and great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located to Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: tayloryen
Reviews.Content: As a solo business traveler, this hotel was conveniently located to the airport. It was simple, clean and there was access to several restaurants for meals. I had a very early flight in the AM (before the free shuttle started) and had the hotel order a taxi. Just a word of caution, the cost of the taxi was outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danny051
Reviews.Content: Service was amazing! Airport shuttle was fast, efficient and friendly. Free WiFi. Close to metro (5 minute walk), which took 20 minutes to Plaza de Espana. Air conditioning was self controlled and powerful. Breakfast was decent, but for 5euross/person it was all that could be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Blaise122
Reviews.Content: If you have been touring Spain outside of Madrid and are just coming to capital area to catch a morning flight, this hotel should suit very well. It is located in the center of Barajas, which, although not being particularly charming or picturesque, is served by a couple of decent restaurants, a pub, even a Burger King. And there is a well-stocked little grocery store directly across the road so you can pick up a wide variety of drinks and snacks if you just want to rest before your next flight. So, unlike other airport hotels where your choice is to stay on the hotel property and not budge, in this place you have options. The rooms are teeny-tiny. But you get what you pay for in that. Otherwise, excellent air conditioning, spotless housekeeping, friendly desk staff, prompt airport shuttle, good soundproofing, WiFi with good signal -- even a tasty and varied breakfast. To those who would put down this establishment, they are welcome to stay in a place more to their liking, and at 3 to 4 times the price they would pay a Best Western Villa Barajas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: pragbov
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night; a really good sized, well equipped single room (makes a change). Good vibrant cafe nearby and metro into town, within 4 minute walk. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ludaluda
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here because our flight was cancelled. This is small, nice and comfortable hotel very close to the airport with free shuttle service. The room was large and clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Good choice for short stays when you have a morning flight out of Barajas airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nondescript airport hotel in drab suburb”
Reviews.Author: RoundtripLAX
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here because we had a 7 am flight out of Madrid and didn't want to take any chances on being late. But this is hotel really is just a place to catch some sleep before flying out. It's located in a drab neighborhood north of Madrid, with no restaurants, cozy bars, shopping, or nightlife to speak of. But there was a packed Burger King next door, a Metro stop a few blocks away, and the breakfast buffet was substantial (eggs, sausage, ceral, bread, etc). Our rooms were extremely small. My father's was a cell-like room with two single beds separated by one tiny nightstand. It was smaller than my single dorm room in college and had not even one picture on the wall. Mine had a queen bed and a small desk/console. Both rooms had adequate bathrooms with excellent water pressure and hair dryer. But the rooms weren't in top condition; there appeared to be some overlooked maintenace that should be resolved. Overall, this was an airport hotel that served its purpose, but a let down after having stayed at the far superior BW Carlos V near the Puerta del Sol for much of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizegg
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about my stay at Hotel Villa de Barajas. The rooms were clean and new. Breakfast was nice and included (just watch out for the step entering the breakfast room--two different women fell at different times while I was eating breakfast.) Some hotel guests complained that the elevator was slow. This is typical for European hotels. There is one small elevator to service 5 floors. It's going to be slow. You should just take the stairs if you're in a hurry. The shades for the rooms were terrific--there are huge outdoor mechanized shades that close with a switch. However, once the side ones were open, I couldn't figure out how to close them. If I were staying longer, I would have asked. The shuttle service was prompt and excellent both arriving and leaving. The only difficult part is calling from the airport to have the shuttle come pick you up. If you are traveling from a foreign country without a cell phone, you need to go outside to the shuttle stand to look up the number, then go back inside to call from a pay phone. It would be nice if there were signs posting the number inside, or having a free station where you can call your hotel before you go outside. All of this took us a while to figure out. I would definitely return to this hotel for another airport stay.

Reviews.Title: “So very average”
Reviews.Author: 8002reverse
Reviews.Content: Near the airport. OK if tired. No decent places to eat nearby. Hotel shuttle bus only seems to operate when nobody wants to use it. Taxis want return trip to airport paid as well and arrives at hotel with 10 Euros on the meter.

Reviews.Title: “room unclean”
Reviews.Author: savoirflair
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend stayed here one night between flights. They gave her a room that was only superficially clean - i.e, the bed was made and the toilet had a strip of paper across it that claimed it had been cleaned. But the bathroom smelled terrible, as if someone had vomited in it (the window had been left open - in an attempt to air out the room?) The floor was sticky (and there was a peanut on the floor- indicating that the place had not been properly vacuumed.) Oddly, the management, when told of this, was most concerned only about the spider she found in the bathtub. They DID give her a new room when she asked, so it wasn't a disaster, but it never should have happened. The new room was on the 4th floor and less exposed to traffic noise. She liked the view. Cost was about $100. She found it too complicated to figure out how to call the hotel to ask for a ride from the airport; she took a cab instead, for about $10.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel - horrible food!”
Reviews.Author: wdwtrekker
Reviews.Content: For an airport hotel this one is fine, rooms are average to small for European standard, clean and comfortable. For those who complained about the window coverings, perhaps you did not know that there are external blinds that you can lower and the room is dark as night even in midday. Location to the airport and nearby metro line to access other areas of Madrid is good. The shuttle to/from the airport was fine. We stayed here on the last day of our 12 day Spain holiday and it was what I expected for a hotel near the airport. Be warned the restaurant in the hotel is horrible - the worst food I've been served in a restaurant in any country. We paid over $100.00 USD for 4 meals that we could only stomach a few bites of - horrible paella - salads so salty you can eat them - and not a bit of concern from the staff when we told them we could not eat what they served us. This in itself is enough reason for me to say I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: FloridaWales
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with the some of the negative statements previous reviewers have made about this hotel. For an airport hotel, the Villa De Barajas is perfectly okay. We arrived at Madrid airport after an overnight flight from the US and the hotel's free shuttle bus picked us up after about a fifteen minute wait. When we checked in, they immediately gave us the key to the room, even though it was only 10am in the morning. The room itself was fairly small but spotlessly clean and quiet enough for us to catch a midday snooze before heading into town. Getting to the center of Madrid is easy and only costs one Euro using the Metro which is just a short walk down the road from the hotel. We visited Retiro park, the Prado, the Reina Sofia and Plaza Mayor before returning to the hotel later that night. The Metro is clean and felt perfectly safe to us. We chose a hotel close to the airport because we had to catch an early morning flight to Rome the next day and did want to get up extra early to allow time to get to the airport. As planned, the hotel shuttle bus got us there on time. Of all of the Madrid airport area hotels that I looked at, this one offered the best rate and I really cannot see any reason to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Another Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations since this was an airport hotel and they were met. The room was small, cold and dark. The beds were soft. The hot water was lukewarm. The window treatments didn't keep out the light. The breakfast was a croissant and coffee. On a positive note, the shuttle was convenient. We called from the airport and the shuttle arrived within 15 minutes. The shuttle driver was friendly. We had no reason to stroll the streets late at night but they didn't look inviting.

Reviews.Title: “OK, convenient to airport, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Luebke
Reviews.Content: This was the third time my wife and I (both seniors) have stayed at the BW Villa Barajas, mainly because it is close to the airport (we rented a car all three times before or after spending time in Madrid) and has good complimenary shuttle service to and from the Barajas airport. The earlier stays (in 2003) were better than our recent May 2005 stay. The price has gone up significantly and the service has, to our mind, gone down somewhat. The breakfast (cold only) was not as good this time and the desk crew, while polite, were more "bureaucratic" and less friendly--far less friendly than last time. Most of the rooms, while very clean, are quite small, with no coffeemaker, although the bathroom is OK in size and connections. One big plus is that the hotel is convenient (2 blocks) to the relatively new airport leg of the Madrid Metro (Barajas station), so visiting locations in the city is a snap. (If there are two or more than one in your party, consider getting the 10-trip ticket at 5.80 euros for a short stay. There is a manned ticket booth at the Barajas station). I think the place has changed management since 2003. Last time it was easily an "above average" place. I can give it only an "average" -- considering price -- this time.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the last night”
Reviews.Author: Pat H
Reviews.Content: It was OK as a place to stay when flying out the next day. Tiny rooms, very noisy (it is being renovated), staff was pleasant. No place nearby for dinner. It was the poorest hotel we had in Spain. But the free shuttle did get us to the airport on time.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: BigDave
Reviews.Content: I got what I was looking for - a good value clean hotel near the airport and the metro. Check in and out were efficient, the staff in the dining room were very friendly, when I faxed later from home to say I'd forgottten to register my stay for points I got an email back very quickly saying that this had been done. The shower was one of the best ever, the rooms seemed to have been refitted recently. My stay was in February 2004, just before the tragic attack on commuter trains. The metro is a separate system and the station is only 300 metres away-it is cheap and takes 40-60 minutes into the city (Tip: choose the lines with the least stations). The second night I ate in and had a good meal, there are restaurants and other hotels in the streets nearby. Of course, being near the airport there is a risk of noise. I got a room on the back, away from both the street and the airport so it was not too bad. It is best to keep windows closed and use the airconditioning which was quite effective. You won't find a coffee tray in the room, despite what the Best Western brochure says, but I prefer to got out to a bar for coffee and get some atmosphere. Yes, I'd go again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Villa De Barajas
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida de Logrono 331, 28042 Madrid, Spain
